meanings.definition: Present participle of the verb 'estate': to establish or settle something, typically property or assets, in a legal document.
meanings.sent1: She is estating her inheritance in the will.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer is estating the terms of the contract.
meanings.sent3: By estating her wishes clearly, she avoided confusion.
meanings.sent4: Estating the boundaries of the land was like drawing a map.
meanings.sent5: He was estating his ownership with confidence.

meanings.definition: Present participle of the verb 'estate': to make a formal declaration or statement.
meanings.sent1: They are estating their intentions at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The president is estating the new policy.
meanings.sent3: Estating their loyalty, they raised their hands.
meanings.sent4: Estating the rules clearly is important for everyone to understand.
meanings.sent5: She was estating her opinion with conviction.

meanings.definition: Present participle of the verb 'estate': to estimate or calculate the value of something.
meanings.sent1: The appraiser is estating the value of the house.
meanings.sent2: Estating the cost of repairs is crucial before buying the car.
meanings.sent3: Estating the price of the antique vase was challenging.
meanings.sent4: Estating the worth of the painting required expertise.
meanings.sent5: She was estating the value of the jewelry with precision.

meanings.definition: Present participle of the verb 'estate': to convey or transfer property to someone through a will or legal document.
meanings.sent1: They are estating the family heirlooms to their children.
meanings.sent2: Estating the house to her niece was a thoughtful gesture.
meanings.sent3: Estating the land to the community brought joy to many.
meanings.sent4: Estating the assets to the beneficiaries was a complex process.
meanings.sent5: She was estating the ownership rights to her sister.
